creator: robertlaferla@attbi.com
text:
"apachectl stop" won't stop httpd processes.  I find that I have to issue the 
command several times and then issue a "apachectl startssl" followed 
by "apachectl stop" to stop apache.

Have you tried sending a kill signal directly to the process listed
in the pid file?
creator: slive@apache.org
robertlaferla@attbi.com
text:
Yes, killall works just fine but that's not the point.  apachectl doesn't work
as it should.

I didn't say killall.  I said kill the paritcular process listed in the pid file.
This should have the effect of shutting down the server.

Also try "httpd -k stop", which is exactly the command that apachectl is running.
creator: slive@apache.org
